description: '''Mỹ Linh''' (born '''Đỗ Mỹ Linh'''; 19 August 1975) is a Vietnamese singer, lyricist, and vocal coach. She is one of the best-selling [[V-pop|Vietnamese music artists]] of all time, having sold an estimated over 2 million records and has often been referred to as the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Queen of Vietnamese R&B]]". My Linh has also been dubbed the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Queen of Spring]]" by media for the enduring popularity of her [[Tết|Tet holiday]] music, particularly her first single <nowiki>''Thi Tham Mua Xuan'' (1993) and "Khuc Giao Mua''</nowiki> (2000). She is widely recognized for her powerful and technically skilled vocals. She is one of the four divas of Vietnam, along with [[Hồng Nhung]], [[Thanh Lam]] and [[Hà Trần]].
